description: Conversations from the Pale Blue Dot is an interfaith interview show, featuring experts from all religions and worldviews, but focusing on the divide between Christianity and atheism.
title: Conversations from the Pale Blue Dot

episodes.title: 090: Toby Ord - Dealing with Moral Uncertainty
episodes.description: What do you do if you don't know which moral theory is correct?

episodes.title: 089: John Shook – Dewey, Quine, and Some Varieties of Naturalism
episodes.description: John and I discuss a variety of naturalistic perspectives.

episodes.title: 088: Eliezer Yudkowsky - Becoming a Rationalist
episodes.description: Eliezer explains his journey from traditional rationality to BayesCraft.

episodes.title: 087: Nick Beckstead - Morality and Global Catastrophic Risks
episodes.description: Nick Beckstead explains the moral issues involved in catastrophic risks.

episodes.title: 086: Peter Rollins - The Role of Atheism in Christianity
episodes.description: Peter Rollins explains the role of doubt and disbelief in Christian practice.

episodes.title: 085: Marcel Brass - The Neuroscience of Free Will
episodes.description: Marcel Brass explains some of the latest research on intentional action on free will.

episodes.title: 084: Eddie Tabash - Engaging Religion in Politics and Debate
episodes.description: Eddie Tabash explains the importance of engaging religion in politics and debate.

episodes.title: 083: Richard Carrier - Historical Method and Jesus of Nazareth
episodes.description: Richard Carrier explains how to do history correctly, and the implications of these methods for our understanding of Jesus.

episodes.title: 082: Eric Schwitzgebel - The Unreliability of Naive Introspection
episodes.description: We are not so good at perceiving our own internal states.

episodes.title: 081: Neil Sinhababu - The Humean Theory of Motivation
episodes.description: Sinhababu defends a Humean theory of motivation.

episodes.title: 080: Robert Gressis - Christian Theism vs. Naturalism
episodes.description: Gressis and I chat about our competing worldviews.

episodes.title: 079: Robert Price - The Crisis of Biblical Authority
episodes.description: Price explains the current debate over Biblical authority in evangelical circles.

episodes.title: 078: Liane Young - How to Change Someone's Moral Judgments with Magnets
episodes.description: Young explains recent moral psychology and its implications for moral philosophy.

episodes.title: 077: Valerie Tiberius - Wisdom and Well-Being
episodes.description: Tiberius analyzes well-being and the notion of a wisely-lived life.

episodes.title: 076: Stephen Batchelor - Secular Buddhism
075: Russell Miller - L. Ron Hubbard Was a Fraud
074: Michael Bishop - An Epistemology for James Randi
episodes.description: Michael Bishop discusses Strategic Reliabilism.

episodes.title: 073: Wynne LeGrow - An Atheist Runs for U.S. Congress
episodes.description: Wynne LeGrow is an atheist political challenger for Virginia's 4th congressional district.

episodes.title: 072: Tyler Wunder - Why Plantinga's Reformed Epistemology Fails
episodes.description: Tyler Wunder explains why Alvin Plantinga's reformed epistemology fails.

episodes.title: 071: Lydia McGrew - The Probability of Christianity
episodes.description: Lydia McGrew discusses evidentialist Christianity.

episodes.title: 070: Ron Mallon - Experimental Ethics
episodes.description: Ron Mallon discusses experimental ethi

episodes.title: 069: Nathan Nobis – Moral Realism and Animals
episodes.description: Nathan Nobis and I debate moral realism, and then discuss the ethical treatment of animals.

episodes.title: 068: Matt Jordan - A Defense of Theistic Ethics
episodes.description: Matt Jordan discusses the criteria for an adequate moral theory, and explains the advantages of theism over naturalism when it comes to morality.

episodes.title: 067: Robin Hanson - Overcoming Bias
episodes.description: Robin Hanson discusses how to overcome our biases.

episodes.title: 066: Andrew Chignell – Debating the Ethics of Belief
episodes.description: Andrew Chignell discusses the problem of infant suffering for theism, and also the ethics of belief.

episodes.title: 065: John Caputo - Postmodernism and Religion
episodes.description: John Caputo discusses postmodernism and religion.

episodes.title: 064: Zachary Moore - How to Build Atheist Communities
episodes.description: Zachary Moore discusses his experience at the head of two atheist organizations and offers his advice on how to build and maintain a successful atheist community.

episodes.title: 063: John Doris - Does Moral Character Exist?
episodes.description: John Doris discusses the possibility that we may not, after all, have much of anything like a robust moral character.

episodes.title: 062: Eric Steinhart - Dawkins and Theism
episodes.description: Eric Steinhart discusses Richard Dawkins' central argument for atheism, NeoPlatonic theology vs. Biblical theology, and also a naturalistic theory of resurrection.

episodes.title: 061: Paul Almond - Why God is a Terrible Explanation for Anything
episodes.description: Paul Almond discusses why 'God did it' is such a terrible explanation for cosmology, design, or anything else.

episodes.title: 060: Stephen Law - The Evil God Challenge
episodes.description: Stephen Law asks: If we can be so sure the universe doesn't exist because an omnipotent evil god made it, why can't we be just as sure an omnipotent good god made it?

episodes.title: 059: Andrew Melnyk - A Humble Physicalism
episodes.description: Philosopher Andrew Melnyk discusses how to define physicalism and the evidence for and against it.

episodes.title: 058: Jaco Gericke - Fundamentalism on Stilts
episodes.description: Bible scholar Jaco Gericke discusses the problems encountered by philosophical theologians when they encounter mainstream Biblical criticism.

episodes.title: 057: Tim Schroeder - Desire and Morality
episodes.description: Philosopher Tim Schroeder explains the major theories of what desire is, and how they relate to moral theories.

episodes.title: 056: Jesse Prinz - Emotions and Moral Judgement
episodes.description: Philosopher of psychology Jesse Prinz discusses emotions and moral judgment.

episodes.title: 055: Massimo Pigliucci - The Limits of Science
episodes.description: Massimo Pigliucci discusses the limits of science and his new book, 'Nonsense on Stilts.'

episodes.title: B03: Luke on Euthyphro, Ignosticism, and More
episodes.description: I discuss the Euthyphro Dilemma, ignosticism, and the question of why atheists find God disgusting.

episodes.title: 054: Bob Price - The Case Against the Case for Christ
episodes.description: Bob Price discusses his latest book, 'The Case Against the Case for Christ.'

episodes.title: 053: Tom Clark - Naturalism as a Positive Worldview
episodes.description: Tom Clark presents naturalism as a robust metaphysical and moral worldview to compete with Christianity, Islam, and other religious worldviews.

episodes.title: 052: Steve Porter - In Defense of Atonement
episodes.description: Philosopher Steve Porter offers his defense of the penal substitutionary theory of the atonement in Christian theology.

episodes.title: 051: Neil Manson - The Design Argument
episodes.description: I interview philosopher Neil Manson about the design argument for God's existence, in all its forms.

episodes.title: 050: David Basinger - Miracles and Open Theism
episodes.description: I interview philosopher and theologian David Basinger about open theism, and also about the nature of miracles.

episodes.title: 049: Jesse Graham - The Morality of Liberals and Conservatives
episodes.description: I interview psychologist Jesse Graham about his research on how we make our moral judgments, and why liberals and conservatives have different moral values.

episodes.title: 048: Konrad Talmont-Kaminski - Naturalism and Supernaturalism
episodes.description: I interview philosopher Konrad Talmont-Kaminski about some varieties of philosophical naturalism and the differences between naturalism and supernaturalism.

episodes.title: 047: Darrel Ray - The God Virus
episodes.description: I interview psychologist Darrel Ray about how religion is like a virus.

episodes.title: 046: James McGrath - Bible Scholarship and the Golden Rule
episodes.description: I interview Bible scholar James McGrath about how he does history according to the Golden Rule.

episodes.title: 045: Richard Carrier - Is Christianity Responsible for Science?
episodes.description: I interview historian and philosopher Richard Carrier about the Christian apologist's claim that Christianity is responsible for modern science.

episodes.title: 044: Greg Ganssle - The New Atheism
episodes.description: I interview Yale philosopher Greg Ganssle about the new atheists: Richard Dawkins and company.

episodes.title: 043: Tim Mawson - A Fine-Tuned Universe
episodes.description: I interview Oxford philosopher and theologian Tim Mawson.

episodes.title: B02: Luke Answers More Questions
episodes.description: I respond directly to the audio questions you submitted to me in response to Ask the Atheist... Audio Edition!

episodes.title: 042: Sean McDowell - Christian Apologetics
episodes.description: Today I interview Christian apologist Sean McDowell, the son of Josh McDowell.

episodes.title: 041: Jaco Gericke - Philosophy of Ancient Israelite Religion
episodes.description: I interview Bible scholar Jaco Gericke about the philosophy of Ancient Israelite religion, as revealed in the Hebrew Bible.

episodes.title: 040: Luke Barnes - 11 Responses to Fine-Tuning
episodes.description: In one of my funniest and most useful episodes yet, I interview astronomer Luke Barnes about the plausibility of 11 responses to the fine-tuning of the universe. Frankly, once you listen to this episode you will be better equipped to discuss fine-tuning than 90% of the people who discuss it on the internet.

episodes.title: 039: Ashley Paramore and Jonathan Weyer - Atheists and Believers Working Together
episodes.description: Today I interview Ashley Paramore, an atheist who works closely with Christians, and Jonathan Weyer, a Christian who works closely with atheists. We discuss the value of getting atheists and believers working together and how to make that happen..

episodes.title: 038: Taner Edis - Science and Nonbelief
episodes.description: I interview physicist Taner Edis about science and religion.

episodes.title: 037: John Loftus - The Christian Delusion
episodes.description: Today I interview John Loftus, author of 'The Christian Delusion.

episodes.title: 036: Scott Sehon - The Problem with "God is Mysterious"
episodes.description: Today I interview philosopher Scott Sehon about the "God is Mysterious" reply to the problem of evil.

episodes.title: 035: Timothy O'Connor - Theism and Ultimate Explanation
episodes.description: Today I interview philosopher Timothy O'Connor about God as an ultimate explanation for why something exists rather than nothing.

episodes.title: 034: Robert Price - How to Study the Historical Jesus
episodes.description: Today I interview New Testament scholar Robert Price about historical method.

episodes.title: 033: Zachary Moore - Evolution 101
episodes.description: Today I interview Dr. Zach from the podcast 'Evolution 101' to discuss what evolutionary theory claims, and why it's true.

episodes.title: B01: Luke Answers Your Questions
episodes.description: I respond directly to the audio questions you submitted to me in response to Ask the Atheist... Audio Edition!

episodes.title: 032: Chris Hallquist - Christianity and Pseudoscience
episodes.description: I interview philosophy graduate student at the University of Notre Dame, Chris Hallquist, about his book 'UFOs, Ghosts, and a Rising God.'

episodes.title: 031: Thomas Crisp - Is the Bible Divinely Inspired?
episodes.description: I interview philosopher Thomas Crisp about three possible ways to justify belief in the divine inspiration of the Bible.

episodes.title: 030: David McNaughton - Divine Command Morality
episodes.description: Today I interview philosopher David McNaughton about divine command morality.

episodes.title: 029: Erik Wielenberg - Non-Natural Moral Realism
episodes.description: Today I interview philosopher Erik Wielenberg.

episodes.title: 028: Eric Reitan - Christianity Beyond Fundamentalism
episodes.description: I interview philosopher and theologian Eric Reitan.

episodes.title: 027: Ken Pulliam - Encouragement to Doubting Christians
episodes.description: Dr. Ken Pulliam left Christianity not because it fell apart when he looked at it from the outside, but because it fell apart when he looked at it from the inside.

episodes.title: 026: John Shook - Naturalism, Humanism, and Democracy
episodes.description: I interview John Shook about positive replacements for a religious worldview - in particular: Naturalism, Humanism, and Democracy.

episodes.title: 025: Stephen Maitzen - Can Theism Ground Morality?
episodes.description: Today I interview atheist philosopher Stephen Maitzen.

episodes.title: 024: Hector Avalos - The End of Biblical Studies
episodes.description: Today I interview Bible scholar Hector Avalos.

episodes.title: 023: James Spiegel - How Immorality Leads to Atheism
episodes.description: I interview James Spiegel about his book: 'The Making of an Atheist: How Immorality Leads to Unbelief.'

episodes.title: 022: Roger Trigg - Religion in the Public Square
episodes.description: I interview Roger Trigg about religion in the public square.

episodes.title: 021: Ruth Chang - What is Morality?
episodes.description: I interview moral philosopher Ruth Chang about contemporary meta-ethics.

episodes.title: 020: James Sennett - The Renaissance of Christian Philosophy
episodes.description: I interview Christian philosopher James Sennett about the religious inclusivism of C.S. Lewis, the renaissance of Christian philosophy, and natural theology vs. the theology of nature.

episodes.title: 019: Kevin Timpe - God and Free Will
episodes.description: I interview Christian philosopher Kevin Timpe about God, free will, philosophy, and theology.

episodes.title: 018: Erik Baldwin - Plantinga and Pluralism
episodes.description: I interview philosopher Erik Baldwin about the three stages of Alvin Plantinga's career, and how religious pluralism poses a challenge to Plantinga's epistemology.

episodes.title: 017: Matt McCormick - Theism and Double Standards
episodes.description: I interview philosopher of religion Matt McCormick about philosophical atheism.

episodes.title: 016: Andrei Buckareff - Belief, Acceptance, and Panentheism
episodes.description: I interview philosopher of religion Andrei Buckareff about acceptance, belief, knowledge, and pantheism.

episodes.title: 015: Wes Morriston - God, Genocide, Craig, and Infinity
episodes.description: I interview Christian philosopher Wes Morriston about God, Genocide, William Lane Craig's Kalam Cosmological Argument, and the nature of infinity.

episodes.title: 014: Brian Hayden - Prehistoric Religion
episodes.description: I interview archaeologists and expert on prehistoric religion Brian Hayden.

episodes.title: 013: Richard Otte - Evil and Miracles
episodes.description: I interview philosopher of religion Richard Otte about the problem of evil, Plantinga's free will defense, and Hume's argument against miracles.

episodes.title: 012: Nick Trakakis - The End of Philosophy of Religion
episodes.description: I interview Nick Trakakis about the problem of evil and other issues in philosophy of religion.

episodes.title: 011: Graham Oppy - Contemporary Atheism
episodes.description: I interview Graham Oppy about the current state of philosophical atheism.

episodes.title: 010: Jessica Pierce - Animal Morality
episodes.description: I interview Jessica Pierce about her book "Wild Justice: The Moral Lives of Animals."

episodes.title: 009: Don Loeb - Moral Irrealism
episodes.description: I interview ethical philosopher Don Loeb about moral irrealism.

episodes.title: 008: Stephen Finlay - The Error in the Error Theory
episodes.description: I interview ethical philosopher Stephen Finlay about his 2008 journal article "The Error in the Error Theory."

episodes.title: 007: Gregory Dawes - Theism and Explanation
episodes.description: I interview Gregory Dawes about his book, 'Theism and Explanation.'

episodes.title: 006: Evan Fales - Reformed Epistemology
episodes.description: I interview atheist philosopher Evan Fales, an expert on the reformed epistemology of Christian philosophers like Alvin Plantinga and William Alston.

episodes.title: 005: Alonzo Fyfe - Desire Utilitarianism
episodes.description: I interview Alonzo Fyfe about his ethical theory, desire utilitarianism.

episodes.title: 004: Mark van Steenwyk - Missional Christianity
episodes.description: I interview Mark van Steenwyk, leader of a non-violent Christianity community. Mark mentored me during the last year of my Christian life.

episodes.title: 003: Alonzo Fyfe - Morality without God
episodes.description: I interview Alonzo Fyfe, who may have written the first ethical theory that has an account of objective moral value that really exists.

episodes.title: 002: Mike Licona - Debating the Resurrection
episodes.description: I interview Christian apologist Mike Licona. We discuss the resurrection, the nature of evidence and probability, gods of the gaps vs. naturalism of the gaps, and much more.

episodes.title: 001: Robert Russell - God and Physics
episodes.description: In the first episode of my new interfaith podcast, I tell my own deconversion story, interview Robert Russell (founder of the Center for Theology and the Natural Sciences), and answer my first listener question: "What is atheism?"
